text: Rakta Nadir Dhara is a 1994 Indian Bengali action film directed by Ram Mukherjee starring Chiranjeet Chakraborty, Prosenjit Chatterjee, Debashree Roy and Sabyasachi Chakraborthy in the lead roles. The film was bankrolled by Rano Mukhopadhyay. The score and soundtrack were composed by Bappi Lahiri. ==Plot== Andaman based criminal Jaga Gunda (Goon) is an international terrorist. Police officer Rupen Roy arrests him and Court directs to imprison Jaga for 21 years. Jaga breaks the jail with the help of a corrupt cop Dibakar and kills Rupen Roy's family. Rupen's only child is alive because he is living in a missionary school. Jaga also kills the judge and witness of the case. Their sons units together and take revenge. ==Cast== * Prosenjit as Partho * Chiranjeet Chakraborty as Rupen Roy * Debashree Roy * Sabyasachi Chakraborty as Abinash * Chinmoy Ray * Dulal Lahiri as Jaga * Debraj Ray as Minister * Nirmal Kumar as Rupen's father * Soumitra Bandyopadhyay as Dibakar * Anamika Saha == Music == The film's musical album comprises 7 tracks all composed by Bappi Lahiri. Venus Worldwide Entertainment bagged the audio rights. The songs upon release garnered positive reviews and topped the musical charts. ===Track listing=== == See also == * Bhai Amar Bhai, 1996 Indian Bengali film == References == == External links == * Category:1994 films Category:Indian films Category:Indian action films Category:1990s Bengali-language films Category:Films directed by Ram Mukherjee Category:1994 action films
title: Rakta Nadir Dhara
